page.title: 02CHANGES IN BRENTWOOD
page.content: Brentwood is a busy town:it has over {56,000}inhabitants. Fifty years ago it was a small village. Today department stores sell everything. Fifty years ago shops were small. Over the years it has grown from only a few{houses}to a town. Today houses are in great demand and are packed together. { { Tar}is the most common road surface of today,but people used to use{flint. The{M25}leads through Brentwood to other parts of the country:there were only{dirt}tracks before.{Transport}was important and still is. At the turn of the century horse and carriage was the main type of transport. { { Warley}is next to Brentwood. Within the{Green Belt}stand the old army barracks.
